{"step_by_step_thinking": "Periapical bone resorption is a process that occurs in response to inflammation and infection in the dental pulp. This process is mediated by various cytokines, including Interleukin-1 alpha (IL-1 alpha) and Tumor Necrosis Factor alpha (TNF alpha). Both of these cytokines play a crucial role in bone resorption by stimulating osteoclasts, the cells responsible for bone resorption.", "answer_choice": "C. Both"}
